title: Poor Dan is in a Droop
subtitle: Digital Comic | May 2023
roles: Project organizer | Lead Developer | Minigame Designer
overview: Poor Dan is in a Droop is a semester-long collaboration between 5 people, having 3 main artists and 2 main developers. We were assigned an unproven topic within quantum physics to attempt to convey through interactivity and visuals. This comic portrays the bi-directional flow of time through the life story of Dan and his mental-health struggles.
contributions: I led development, organized the team, and designed minigames.
challenges: Balancing narrative clarity with technical constraints taught me how to manage scope effectively.

title: ABC Stories
subtitle: Educational iOS AR App Overhaul | May 2024
overview: As a GIMM Research Developer, I collaborated with colleagues to overhaul an AR app designed to teach young children letter writing. Initially, the app depended on a website for data management, incurring significant costs to comply with FERPA regulations. Our team redesigned the app to eliminate the need for a third-party host, saving our client about $1000 per month.
contributions: I contributed to Swift development and data management design.
challenges: I learned how to transition from a hosted backend to a standalone application.

title: Geoscience Exhibit
subtitle: 3D Exhibit for Android | February 2024
overview: As a GIMM Research Developer, I helped develop an Android Unity experience for an exhibit at the 2024 Personal Structures Exhibition in Venice, Italy. It displays geological drone data gathered by Boise State University's Human-Environment Systems department in an interactive manner. Exhibitors are able to immerse themselves in the environment while learning about invasive plant species in Idaho.
contributions: I implemented core C# features and UI elements.
challenges: I gained experience optimizing Unity apps for Android devices.

title: Fish & Game: Hunter Safety VR
subtitle: VR Simulation | May 2025
overview: Fish & Game: Hunter Safety VR is an application developed as supplementary material for hunter's safety classrooms. The goal was to allow students to practice firearm handling and ethical hunting before being placed in real-life scenarios. We collaborated with Fish and Wildlife departments from 13 states on a six-figure budget over the course of 8 months.
contributions: I led scenario design and oversaw core development.
challenges: Managing large-scale collaboration across multiple state agencies gave me valuable leadership experience.

title: FireFlyers
subtitle: 3D | Networked Multiplayer
overview: Personal indie project exploring real-time multiplayer networking.
contributions: Built network code and gameplay loop.
challenges: First project in Unreal after years in Unity,.

title: Kestrel
subtitle: VR | Educational Simulation
overview: VR educational simulation in collaboration with the BSU Raptor Research Center and Meta.

title: Brain Health
subtitle: VR | Sensory Experience
overview: VR project exploring brain health research with Boise State Psychology and Engineering.

title: Harmony of The Spheres
subtitle: 2D | Indie Puzzle

title: Skeet Shooter VR

overview: VR skeet shooting simulation created for GIMM 480.
